metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1248 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
vim before patch 8.0.0056 does not properly validate values for the 'filetype', 'syntax' and 'keymap' options, which may result in the execution of arbitrary code if a file with a specially crafted modeline is opened. Florian Larysch discovered that the Vim text editor did not properly validate values for the 'filetype', 'syntax', and 'keymap' options. An attacker could trick a user into opening a file with specially crafted modelines and possibly execute arbitrary code with the user's privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1248` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.2
vim-athena - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.2
vim-athena-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.2
vim-common - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.2
vim-gnome - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.2
vim-gnome-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.2
vim-gtk - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.2
vim-gtk-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.2
vim-gtk3 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.2
vim-gtk3-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.2
vim-gui-common - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.2
vim-nox - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.2
vim-nox-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.2
vim-runtime - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.2
vim-tiny - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vim package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.2').
